comments:
Installing eclipse on FC4 with a properly installed and built Sun Java 
installation. 
 
SDK runs fine.  Stable, no errors, etc.  
 
Installing cdt-3.0.0 throws these errors.  The first is a missing TableLock 
file.  I've confirmed it is indeed not there. 
 
 
 
$usr/share/eclipse/eclipse  
!SESSION 2005-11-14 01:36:31.343  
-----------------------------------------------  
eclipse.buildId=M20050929-0840  
java.version=1.5.0_05  
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.  
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US  
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86  
  
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-11-14 01:36:31.555  
!MESSAGE Error reading  
configuration: /usr/share/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/.manager/.fileTableLock  
(No such file or directory)  
!STACK 0  
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /usr/share/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/.manager/.fileTableLock  
(No such file or directory)  
        at java.io.FileOutputStream.openAppend(Native Method)  
        at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:177)

org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.startup(EclipseStarter.java:272)

        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948)

Found more information.  The install works properly as root, but not as a 
regular user.

This was a permissions problem.  I ran:

cd eclipse
chown -R root *
chown root .eclipseproduct
chown -R krlux *
chown krlux .eclipseproduct

And it works fine.
Since it appears that there was no problem with CDT, I'm going to mark this INVALID.
